title: Przemysław Norko
text:
Przemysław Norko (born 29 March 1979) is a Polish professional <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> goalkeeper. He played for <a href="Poland%20national%20football%20team">Poland</a> at Under-21 level. He currently plays for <a href="Arkonia%20Szczecin">Arkonia Szczecin</a>.
Norko was born in <a href="Szczecin">Szczecin</a> and began his career in his native Poland with <a href="Chemik%20Police">Chemik Police</a> before joining <a href="Zag%C5%82%C4%99bie%20Lubin">Zagłębie Lubin</a>. He made his 1st Division debut on 23 August 1997, coming on as a substitute in a 3-1 defeat away to <a href="Widzew%20%C5%81%C3%B3d%C5%BA">Widzew Łódź</a>. He played six more times before being sent off in the 4-1 win away to <a href="Pogo%C5%84%20Szczecin">Pogoń Szczecin</a> on 25 October 1997. he played just once more that season, appearing in the 2-0 defeat away to <a href="Legia%20Warsaw">Legia Warsaw</a> on 9 June 1998. He played twice the following season, in the August games against <a href="%C5%81KS%20%C5%81%C3%B3d%C5%BA">ŁKS Łódź</a> and <a href="G%C3%B3rnik%20Zabrze">Górnik Zabrze</a> before leaving to join Odra Szczecin.
He subsequently played for <a href="Polar%20Wroc%C5%82aw">Polar Wrocław</a> and <a href="G%C3%B3rnik%20Polkowice">Górnik Polkowice</a> before returning to Zagłębie in 2001. However, he played just once, in a 3-0 cup defeat away to <a href="G%C3%B3rnik%20%C5%81%C4%99czna">Górnik Łęczna</a> on 10 October 2001.
In 2002, he moved to <a href="Pogo%C5%84%20Szczecin">Pogoń Szczecin</a>, playing nine league games and once in the cup before leaving to join <a href="Ruch%20Wysokie%20Mazowieckie">Ruch Wysokie Mazowieckie</a>. He then moved to <a href="Greece">Greek</a> 2nd Division side <a href="Akratitos">Akratitos</a> in 2004. In 2005, he moved to <a href="Albania">Albania</a>n side <a href="KF%20Partizani%20Tirana">Partizani Tirana</a>, before returning to Poland with <a href="Ruch%20Chorz%C3%B3w">Ruch Chorzów</a>. However, he was unable to play for Chorzow due to a lack of international clearance from the Albanian Football Association.
In January 2007 he joined <a href="Torquay%20United%20F.C.">Torquay United</a>, initially on a one-month contract, the first of a number of cheap foreign imports promised by new Torquay chairman <a href="Chris%20Roberts%20%28chairman%29">Chris Roberts</a>. However, a delay with his international clearance prevented him making his debut in the <a href="FA%20Cup">FA Cup</a> against <a href="Southampton%20F.C.">Southampton</a>. There was later a problem with his medical and the contract was cancelled.
He returned to Poland to play for Kania Gostyń, joining <a href="Pogo%C5%84%20Szczecin">Pogoń Szczecin</a> in March 2008. He subsequently joined <a href="Arkonia%20Szczecin">Arkonia Szczecin</a>.
